messageBody:
>Here, Request.aClass(testClass).getRunner() will look at the @RunWith
>annotation, and will attempt to assign to delegate, you guessed it,
>another VerboseRunner, which will call
>Request.aClass(testClass).getRunner(), which will...

>Probably what you want here is

>delegate= new TestClassRunner(testClass);

>Let me know if that nails it,
> David Saff

That was it, thanks.

The actual goal was to filter out tests annotated as @Optional unless a flag
was set, so the runner wound up looking like this:

public OptionalRunner(Class<?> testClass) throws Exception {
delegate = new TestClassRunner(testClass);
new OptionalFilter().apply(delegate);
}

and the filter wound up with:

@Override
public boolean shouldRun(Description description) {
return (runAll() || !isOptional(description));
} // shouldRun

This works, though the isOptional() method is clunky, since it parses the
description string to get the class to get the method to get the
annotations.

Again, thanks.

- Dani Zweig
